pages.text: I've happened upon a type of stone that seems to be saturated with magic. Upon breaking it, it released its quintessence.$(br2)Perhaps by being exposed to leylines, these stones have soaked in magic, and solidified it, allowing for collection.$(br2)I'll use this section to record my findings.
Magicite seems to occassionally contain vis specks upon breaking.
This familiar looking stone is what is left after magicite has been depleted of its essence. Still, however, it has decorative uses that Botanical fans might enjoy.

pages.title: Mundane Quintessence
pages.text: Magicite seems to only contain basic quintessence. Due to its correlation with leylines, I wonder if there is a way to open the flow of additional leylines, allowing for a wider variety of quintessence.$(br2)Additionally, there seems to be a correlation between magicite color, biome, and the quintessence it contains.

pages.title: Mundane Quintessence
pages.text: A sample of mundane quintessence. There are more of these to discover.

pages.title: Arcane Quintessence
pages.text: Ah-ha! Defeating certain foes in the world unlocks the flow of additional leylines.$(br2)Mining magicite of the correct color and biome should reveal they contain more types of quintessence.$(br2)I wonder if there is yet more leylines to unlock...

pages.title: Mystical Quintessence
pages.text: Eureka! Opening portals and piercing the veil to other worlds causes a torrent of magick to flow into this world.$(br2)I'm willing to bet magicite has soaked up these leylines.$(br2)Additionally, these worlds themselves contain saturated magicite.
